content.rendered:
Asia Cup 2023 schedule has been announced, which will be co-hosted by Sri Lanka and Pakistan. The Asia Cup will take place from 30 August 2023 to 17 September 2023.

The first match takes place between Pakistan and Nepal in Multan. There are Six teams which are divided into two groups of three teams each for the fifty-overs version of the competition.

(Read Also: Top Earners Revealed by Hopper HQ- Virat Kohli Named Instagram’s Top Earner From India)

Group A consists of Bangladesh, Afghanistan, and Sri Lanka, whereas Group B consists of Pakistan, India, and Nepal. The competition will use a hybrid format, with Sri Lanka hosting the remaining games and Pakistan hosting four matches spread over two locations.

The legendary match between Pakistan and India is scheduled for September 2 in Kandy.

After the six group-stage games, starting on September 6, there will be the Super 4s.

The teams in the top two slots after the conclusion of the Super 4s will play in the final on September 17 in Colombo.
